00023 /*
00024  * Copyright (c) 2013, 2015, Intel Corporation.
00025  * Use is subject to license terms.
00026  *
00027  * lustre/osp/lwp_dev.c
00028  *
00029  * This file provides code related to the Light Weight Proxy (LWP) managing
00030  * the connections established from OST to MDT, and MDT to MDT0.
00031  *
00032  * A LWP connection is used to send quota and FLD query requests. It's not
00033  * recoverable, which means target server doesn't have an on-disk record in
00034  * the last_rcvd file to remember the connection. Once LWP reconnect after
00035  * server reboot, server will always regard it as a new connection.
00036  *
00037  * Author: <di.wang@intel.com>
00038  * Author: <yawei.niu@intel.com>
00039  */
00040 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_OST
00041 
00042 #include <obd_class.h>
00043 #include <lustre_param.h>
00044 #include <lustre_log.h>
00045 #include <linux/kthread.h>
00046 
00047 #include "osp_internal.h"
00048 
00049 struct lwp_device {
00050         struct lu_device        lpd_dev;
00051         struct obd_device      *lpd_obd;   /* corresponding OBD device */
00052         struct obd_uuid         lpd_cluuid;/* UUID of LWP */
00053         struct obd_export      *lpd_exp;   /* export of LWP */
00054         struct ptlrpc_thread    lpd_notify_thread; /* notify thread */
00055         int                     lpd_connects; /* use count, 0 or 1 */
00056 };
00057 
00058 static inline struct lwp_device *lu2lwp_dev(struct lu_device *d)
00059 {
00060         return container_of0(d, struct lwp_device, lpd_dev);
00061 }
00062 
00063 static inline struct lu_device *lwp2lu_dev(struct lwp_device *d)
00064 {
00065         return &d->lpd_dev;
00066 }
00067 
00078 static int lwp_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct lwp_device *lwp,
00079                      char *nidstring)
00080 {
00081         struct lustre_cfg_bufs  *bufs = NULL;
00082         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg = NULL;
00083         char                    *lwp_name = lwp->lpd_obd->obd_name;
00084         char                    *server_uuid = NULL;
00085         char                    *ptr;
00086         class_uuid_t             uuid;
00087         struct obd_import       *imp;
00088         int                      len = strlen(lwp_name) + 1;
00089         int                      rc;
00090         ENTRY;
00091 
00092         thread_set_flags(&lwp->lpd_notify_thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00093         init_waitqueue_head(&lwp->lpd_notify_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00094 
00095         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(bufs);
00096         if (bufs == NULL)
00097                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00098 
00099         OBD_ALLOC(server_uuid, len);
00100         if (server_uuid == NULL)
00101                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00102 
00103         snprintf(server_uuid, len, "-%s-", LUSTRE_LWP_NAME);
00104         ptr = cfs_strrstr(lwp_name, server_uuid);
00105         if (ptr == NULL) {
00106                 CERROR("%s: failed to get server_uuid from lwp_name: rc = %d\n",
00107                        lwp_name, -EINVAL);
00108                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00109         }
00110 
00111         strncpy(server_uuid, lwp_name, ptr - lwp_name);
00112         server_uuid[ptr - lwp_name] = '\0';
00113         strlcat(server_uuid, "_UUID", len);
00114         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, lwp_name);
00115         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, server_uuid);
00116         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 2, nidstring);
00117         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_SETUP, bufs);
00118         if (lcfg == NULL)
00119                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00120 
00121         rc = client_obd_setup(lwp->lpd_obd, lcfg);
00122         if (rc != 0) {
00123                 CERROR("%s: client obd setup error: rc = %d\n",
00124                        lwp->lpd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00125                 GOTO(out, rc);
00126         }
00127 
00128         imp = lwp->lpd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00129         rc = ptlrpc_init_import(imp);
00130         if (rc)
00131                 GOTO(out, rc);
00132 
00133         ll_generate_random_uuid(uuid);
00134         class_uuid_unparse(uuid, &lwp->lpd_cluuid);
00135 out:
00136         if (bufs != NULL)
00137                 OBD_FREE_PTR(bufs);
00138         if (server_uuid != NULL)
00139                 OBD_FREE(server_uuid, len);
00140         if (lcfg != NULL)
00141                 lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00142         if (rc)
00143                 client_obd_cleanup(lwp->lpd_obd);
00144 
00145         RETURN(rc);
00146 }
00147 
00156 static int lwp_disconnect(struct lwp_device *d)
00157 {
00158         struct obd_import *imp;
00159         int rc = 0;
00160 
00161         imp = d->lpd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00162 
00163         /*
00164          * Mark import deactivated now, so we don't try to reconnect if any
00165          * of the cleanup RPCs fails (e.g. ldlm cancel, etc).  We don't
00166          * fully deactivate the import because that would cause all requests
00167          * to be dropped.
00168          */
00169         LASSERT(imp != NULL);
00170         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00171         imp->imp_deactive = 1;
00172         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00173 
00174         ptlrpc_deactivate_import(imp);
00175 
00176         /*
00177          * Some non-replayable imports (MDS's OSCs) are pinged, so just
00178          * delete it regardless.  (It's safe to delete an import that was
00179          * never added.)
00180          */
00181         ptlrpc_pinger_del_import(imp);
00182         rc = ptlrpc_disconnect_import(imp, 0);
00183         if (rc != 0)
00184                 CWARN("%s: can't disconnect: rc = %d\n",
00185                       d->lpd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00186 
00187         ptlrpc_invalidate_import(imp);
00188 
00189         RETURN(rc);
00190 }
00191 
00204 static int lwp_process_config(const struct lu_env *env,
00205                               struct lu_device *dev, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00206 {
00207         struct lwp_device               *d = lu2lwp_dev(dev);
00208         int                              rc;
00209         ENTRY;
00210 
00211         switch (lcfg->lcfg_command) {
00212         case LCFG_PRE_CLEANUP:
00213         case LCFG_CLEANUP:
00214                 rc = lwp_disconnect(d);
00215                 break;
00216         case LCFG_PARAM:
00217                 rc = -ENOSYS;
00218                 break;
00219         default:
00220                 CERROR("%s: unknown command %u\n",
00221                        (char *)lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), lcfg->lcfg_command);
00222                 rc = 0;
00223                 break;
00224         }
00225 
00226         RETURN(rc);
00227 }
00228 
00229 static const struct lu_device_operations lwp_lu_ops = {
00230         .ldo_process_config     = lwp_process_config,
00231 };
00232 
00245 static int lwp_init0(const struct lu_env *env, struct lwp_device *lwp,
00246                      struct lu_device_type *ldt, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00247 {
00248         int                        rc;
00249         ENTRY;
00250 
00251         lwp->lpd_obd = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
00252         if (lwp->lpd_obd == NULL) {
00253                 CERROR("Cannot find obd with name %s\n",
00254                        lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
00255                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
00256         }
00257 
00258         lwp->lpd_dev.ld_ops = &lwp_lu_ops;
00259         lwp->lpd_obd->obd_lu_dev = &lwp->lpd_dev;
00260 
00261         rc = ptlrpcd_addref();
00262         if (rc) {
00263                 CERROR("%s: ptlrpcd addref error: rc =%d\n",
00264                        lwp->lpd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00265                 RETURN(rc);
00266         }
00267 
00268         rc = lwp_setup(env, lwp, lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 1));
00269         if (rc) {
00270                 CERROR("%s: setup lwp failed. %d\n",
00271                        lwp->lpd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00272                 ptlrpcd_decref();
00273                 RETURN(rc);
00274         }
00275 
00276         if (lprocfs_obd_setup(lwp->lpd_obd) == 0) {
00277                 sptlrpc_lprocfs_cliobd_attach(lwp->lpd_obd);
00278                 ptlrpc_lprocfs_register_obd(lwp->lpd_obd);
00279         }
00280 
00281         RETURN(0);
00282 }
00283 
00296 static struct lu_device *lwp_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
00297                                          struct lu_device *lu)
00298 {
00299         struct lwp_device *m = lu2lwp_dev(lu);
00300         ENTRY;
00301 
00302         if (atomic_read(&lu->ld_ref) && lu->ld_site) {
00303                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_ERROR, NULL);
00304                 lu_site_print(env, lu->ld_site, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer);
00305         }
00306         lu_device_fini(&m->lpd_dev);
00307         OBD_FREE_PTR(m);
00308         RETURN(NULL);
00309 }
00310 
00323 static struct lu_device *lwp_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00324                                           struct lu_device_type *ldt,
00325                                           struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00326 {
00327         struct lwp_device *lwp;
00328         struct lu_device  *ludev;
00329 
00330         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lwp);
00331         if (lwp == NULL) {
00332                 ludev = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00333         } else {
00334                 int rc;
00335 
00336                 ludev = lwp2lu_dev(lwp);
00337                 lu_device_init(&lwp->lpd_dev, ldt);
00338                 rc = lwp_init0(env, lwp, ldt, lcfg);
00339                 if (rc != 0) {
00340                         lwp_device_free(env, ludev);
00341                         ludev = ERR_PTR(rc);
00342                 }
00343         }
00344         return ludev;
00345 }
00346 
00347 
00358 static struct lu_device *lwp_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00359                                          struct lu_device *ludev)
00360 {
00361         struct lwp_device       *m = lu2lwp_dev(ludev);
00362         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread = &m->lpd_notify_thread;
00363         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
00364         struct obd_import       *imp;
00365         int                      rc;
00366         ENTRY;
00367 
00368         if (!thread_is_stopped(thread))
00369                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq, thread_is_stopped(thread),
00370                              &lwi);
00371 
00372         if (m->lpd_exp != NULL)
00373                 class_disconnect(m->lpd_exp);
00374 
00375         imp = m->lpd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00376 
00377         LASSERT(m->lpd_obd);
00378         ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_obd(m->lpd_obd);
00379         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(m->lpd_obd);
00380 
00381         rc = client_obd_cleanup(m->lpd_obd);
00382         LASSERTF(rc == 0, "error %d\n", rc);
00383 
00384         ptlrpcd_decref();
00385 
00386         RETURN(NULL);
00387 }
00388 
00389 static struct lu_device_type_operations lwp_device_type_ops = {
00390         .ldto_device_alloc   = lwp_device_alloc,
00391         .ldto_device_free    = lwp_device_free,
00392         .ldto_device_fini    = lwp_device_fini
00393 };
00394 
00395 struct lu_device_type lwp_device_type = {
00396         .ldt_tags     = LU_DEVICE_DT,
00397         .ldt_name     = LUSTRE_LWP_NAME,
00398         .ldt_ops      = &lwp_device_type_ops,
00399         .ldt_ctx_tags = LCT_MD_THREAD
00400 };
00401 
00402 static int lwp_notify_main(void *args)
00403 {
00404         struct obd_export       *exp = (struct obd_export *)args;
00405         struct lwp_device       *lwp;
00406         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread;
00407 
00408         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
00409         lwp = lu2lwp_dev(exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
00410         thread = &lwp->lpd_notify_thread;
00411 
00412         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_RUNNING);
00413         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00414 
00415         lustre_notify_lwp_list(exp);
00416 
00417         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00418         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00419         return 0;
00420 }
00421 
00422 /*
00423  * Some notify callbacks may cause deadlock in failover
00424  * scenario, so we have to start thread to run callbacks
00425  * asynchronously. See LU-6273.
00426  */
00427 static void lwp_notify_users(struct obd_export *exp)
00428 {
00429         struct lwp_device       *lwp;
00430         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread;
00431         struct task_struct      *task;
00432         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
00433         char                     name[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00434 
00435         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
00436         lwp = lu2lwp_dev(exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
00437         thread = &lwp->lpd_notify_thread;
00438 
00439         snprintf(name, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN, "lwp_notify_%s",
00440                  exp->exp_obd->obd_name);
00441 
00442         /* Notify happens only on LWP setup, so there shouldn't
00443          * be notify thread running */
00444         if (!thread_is_stopped(thread)) {
00445                 CERROR("LWP notify thread: %s wasn't stopped\n", name);
00446                 return;
00447         }
00448 
00449         task = kthread_run(lwp_notify_main, exp, name);
00450         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00451                 thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00452                 CERROR("Failed to start LWP notify thread:%s. %lu\n",
00453                        name, PTR_ERR(task));
00454         }
00455 
00456         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
00457                      thread_is_running(thread) || thread_is_stopped(thread),
00458                      &lwi);
00459 }
00460 
00476 static int lwp_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export **exp,
00477                            struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
00478                            struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
00479 {
00480         struct lwp_device       *lwp = lu2lwp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00481         struct client_obd       *cli = &lwp->lpd_obd->u.cli;
00482         struct obd_import       *imp = cli->cl_import;
00483         struct obd_connect_data *ocd;
00484         struct lustre_handle     conn;
00485         int                      rc;
00486 
00487         ENTRY;
00488 
00489         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "connect #%d\n", lwp->lpd_connects);
00490 
00491         *exp = NULL;
00492         down_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00493         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
00494         if (rc != 0)
00495                 GOTO(out_sem, rc);
00496 
00497         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
00498         lwp->lpd_exp = *exp;
00499 
00500         lwp->lpd_connects++;
00501         LASSERT(lwp->lpd_connects == 1);
00502 
00503         imp->imp_dlm_handle = conn;
00504         rc = ptlrpc_init_import(imp);
00505         if (rc != 0)
00506                 GOTO(out_dis, rc);
00507 
00508         LASSERT(data != NULL);
00509         ocd = &imp->imp_connect_data;
00510         *ocd = *data;
00511 
00512         LASSERT(ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT);
00513 
00514         ocd->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00515         imp->imp_connect_flags_orig = ocd->ocd_connect_flags;
00516 
00517         rc = ptlrpc_connect_import(imp);
00518         if (rc != 0) {
00519                 CERROR("%s: can't connect obd: rc = %d\n", obd->obd_name, rc);
00520                 GOTO(out_dis, rc);
00521         }
00522 
00523         ptlrpc_pinger_add_import(imp);
00524 
00525         GOTO(out_dis, rc = 0);
00526 
00527 out_dis:
00528         if (rc != 0) {
00529                 class_disconnect(*exp);
00530                 *exp = NULL;
00531                 lwp->lpd_exp = NULL;
00532         }
00533 
00534 out_sem:
00535         up_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00536 
00537         if (rc == 0)
00538                 lwp_notify_users(*exp);
00539 
00540         return rc;
00541 }
00542 
00554 static int lwp_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
00555 {
00556         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00557         struct lwp_device *lwp = lu2lwp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00558         int                rc;
00559         ENTRY;
00560 
00561         LASSERT(lwp->lpd_connects == 1);
00562         lwp->lpd_connects--;
00563 
00564         rc = class_disconnect(exp);
00565         if (rc)
00566                 CERROR("%s: class disconnect error: rc = %d\n",
00567                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00568 
00569         RETURN(rc);
00570 }
00571 
00582 static int lwp_import_event(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_import *imp,
00583                             enum obd_import_event event)
00584 {
00585         switch (event) {
00586         case IMP_EVENT_DISCON:
00587         case IMP_EVENT_INACTIVE:
00588         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVE:
00589                 break;
00590         case IMP_EVENT_INVALIDATE:
00591                 if (obd->obd_namespace == NULL)
00592                         break;
00593                 ldlm_namespace_cleanup(obd->obd_namespace, LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY);
00594                 break;
00595         case IMP_EVENT_OCD:
00596                 break;
00597         default:
00598                 CERROR("%s: unsupported import event: %#x\n",
00599                        obd->obd_name, event);
00600         }
00601         return 0;
00602 }
00603 
00604 static int lwp_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env,
00605                               struct obd_export *exp,
00606                               u32 keylen, void *key,
00607                               u32 vallen, void *val,
00608                               struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
00609 {
00610         ENTRY;
00611 
00612         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF)) {
00613                 sptlrpc_conf_client_adapt(exp->exp_obd);
00614                 RETURN(0);
00615         }
00616 
00617         CERROR("Unknown key %s\n", (char *)key);
00618         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00619 }

00621 struct obd_ops lwp_obd_device_ops = {
00622         .o_owner        = THIS_MODULE,
00623         .o_add_conn     = client_import_add_conn,
00624         .o_del_conn     = client_import_del_conn,
00625         .o_connect      = lwp_obd_connect,
00626         .o_disconnect   = lwp_obd_disconnect,
00627         .o_import_event = lwp_import_event,
00628         .o_set_info_async   = lwp_set_info_async,
00629 };
